item.title: Morgana King - Everybody Loves Saturday Night - Key of C
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C.
As performed by Morgana King.
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts and Google Play.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for DGBE ukulele. Key of C.

Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Baritone Ukulele, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts and Google Play.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Michael Bublé - Sway - Key of Dm
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of Dm.
As performed by Michael Bublé.
The original shifts up a half step at the end...this version stays in Dm. This is a great song to play/sing!
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.

item.title: Larry Clinton - Heart and Soul - Key of C
item.description:
For Educational Use. As performed by Larry Clinton and His Orchestra. In the Key of C ( C, Am, F, G7, Dm, C7, E7, A7, B7), with some surprises in the less familiar portion of the song.
There are some very quick chord changes and chord ambiguity in those same less familiar verses. These didn't work out as well as I would have hoped for...but the main instructional point is repetition of C, Am, F, G7, following the instructional materials used by the Tampa Bay Ukulele Society.
The original video comes from: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pNjpTOB4ksY
My apologies to every music teacher who cringes as students play this song on the piano!
The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education from ukefarm.com

item.title: The Jive Aces - Bring Me Sunshine - Key of Bb, C
item.description:
From the Jive Aces..."Bring Me Sunshine." The song uses a lot of chords, starting in Bb (Bb, Cm, F7, Bb7, C7, Eb) and then modulating with a change of tempo to C (C, Dm, G7, C7, D7, F). If working with beginners, try starting at the faster tempo where it changes to C.
This appears for educational use...please support the Jive Aces (who use ukulele) by downloading their albums and songs.
The audio comes from the official Jive Aces video (only the music used):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oXvJ8UquYoo
I created the printed lyrics on Keynote, edited in iMovie. Transparency of the sun icon was created in Preview. The chords that are used are a part of the Chordette for Education fonts from ukefarm.com.
